title: Communist Manifesto

text: MANIFESTO OF THE COMMUNIST PARTY
title: Communist Manifesto

text: [From the English edition of 1888, edited by Friedrich Engels]
title: Communist Manifesto

text: A spectre is haunting Europe--the spectre of Communism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: All the Powers of old Europe have entered into a holy alliance to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exorcise this spectre: Pope and Czar, Metternich and Guizot,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: French Radicals and German police-spies.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Where is the party in opposition that has not been decried as
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Communistic by its opponents in power?  Where is the Opposition
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that has not hurled back the branding reproach of Communism,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: against the more advanced opposition parties, as well as against
title: Communist Manifesto

text: its reactionary adversaries?
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Two things result from this fact.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: I.  Communism is already acknowledged by all European Powers
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to be itself a Power.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: II.  It is high time that Communists should openly, in the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: face of the whole world, publish their views, their aims, their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: tendencies, and meet this nursery tale of the Spectre of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Communism with a Manifesto of the party itself.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: To this end, Communists of various nationalities have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: assembled in London, and sketched the following Manifesto, to be
title: Communist Manifesto

text: published in the English, French, German, Italian, Flemish and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Danish languages.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: I.  BOURGEOIS AND PROLETARIANS
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The history of all hitherto existing societies is the history
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of class struggles.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Freeman and slave, patrician and plebeian, lord and serf,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: guild-master and journeyman, in a word, oppressor and oppressed,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: stood in constant opposition to one another, carried on an
title: Communist Manifesto

text: uninterrupted, now hidden, now open fight, a fight that each time
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ended, either in a revolutionary re-constitution of society at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: large, or in the common ruin of the contending classes.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In the earlier epochs of history, we find almost everywhere a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: complicated arrangement of society into various orders, a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: manifold gradation of social rank.  In ancient Rome we have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: patricians, knights, plebeians, slaves; in the Middle Ages,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: feudal lords, vassals, guild-masters, journeymen, apprentices,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: serfs; in almost all of these classes, again, subordinate
title: Communist Manifesto

text: gradations.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The modern bourgeois society that has sprouted from the ruins
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of feudal society has not done away with class antagonisms.  It
title: Communist Manifesto

text: has but established new classes, new conditions of oppression,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: new forms of struggle in place of the old ones.  Our epoch, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: epoch of the bourgeoisie, possesses, however, this distinctive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: feature: it has simplified the class antagonisms. Society as a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: whole is more and more splitting up into two great hostile camps,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: into two great classes, directly facing each other: Bourgeoisie
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and Proletariat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: From the serfs of the Middle Ages sprang the chartered burghers
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the earliest towns.  From these burgesses the first elements
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the bourgeoisie were developed.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The discovery of America, the rounding of the Cape, opened up
title: Communist Manifesto

text: fresh ground for the rising bourgeoisie. The East-Indian and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Chinese markets, the colonisation of America, trade with
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the colonies, the increase in the means of exchange and in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: commodities generally, gave to commerce, to navigation, to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: industry, an impulse never before known, and thereby, to the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolutionary element in the tottering feudal society, a rapid
title: Communist Manifesto

text: development.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The feudal system of industry, under which industrial production
title: Communist Manifesto

text: was monopolised by closed guilds, now no longer sufficed for the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: growing wants of the new markets.  The manufacturing system took
title: Communist Manifesto

text: its place.  The guild-masters were pushed on one side by the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: manufacturing middle class; division of labour between the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: different corporate guilds vanished in the face of division of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: labour in each single workshop.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Meantime the markets kept ever growing, the demand ever rising.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Even manufacture no longer sufficed.  Thereupon, steam and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: machinery revolutionised industrial production.  The place of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: manufacture was taken by the giant, Modern Industry, the place of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the industrial middle class, by industrial millionaires, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: leaders of whole industrial armies, the modern bourgeois.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Modern industry has established the world-market, for which the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: discovery of America paved the way.  This market has given an
title: Communist Manifesto

text: immense development to commerce, to navigation, to communication
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by land.  This development has, in its time, reacted on the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: extension of industry; and in proportion as industry, commerce,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: navigation, railways extended, in the same proportion the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie developed, increased its capital, and pushed into the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: background  every class handed down from the Middle Ages.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: We see, therefore, how the modern bourgeoisie is itself the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: product of a long course of development, of a series of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolutions in the modes of production and of exchange.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Each step in the development of the bourgeoisie was accompanied
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by a corresponding political advance of that class.  An
title: Communist Manifesto

text: oppressed class under the sway of the feudal nobility, an
title: Communist Manifesto

text: armed and self-governing association in the mediaeval commune;
title: Communist Manifesto

text: here independent urban republic (as in Italy and Germany),
title: Communist Manifesto

text: there taxable "third estate" of the monarchy (as in France),
title: Communist Manifesto

text: afterwards, in the  period of manufacture proper, serving either
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the semi-feudal or the absolute monarchy as a counterpoise
title: Communist Manifesto

text: against the nobility, and, in fact, corner-stone of the great
title: Communist Manifesto

text: monarchies in general, the bourgeoisie has at last, since the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: establishment of Modern Industry and of the world-market,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conquered for itself, in the modern representative State,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exclusive political sway.  The executive of the modern State is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: but a committee for managing the common affairs of the whole
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie, historically, has played a most revolutionary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: part.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie, wherever it has got the upper hand, has put an
title: Communist Manifesto

text: end to all feudal, patriarchal, idyllic relations.  It has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: pitilessly torn asunder the motley feudal ties that bound man to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: his "natural superiors," and has left remaining no other nexus
title: Communist Manifesto

text: between man and man than naked self-interest, than callous "cash
title: Communist Manifesto

text: payment."  It has drowned the most heavenly ecstasies of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: religious fervour, of chivalrous enthusiasm, of philistine
title: Communist Manifesto

text: sentimentalism, in the icy water of egotistical calculation.  It
title: Communist Manifesto

text: has resolved personal worth into exchange value, and in place of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the numberless and indefeasible chartered freedoms, has set up that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: single, unconscionable freedom--Free Trade.  In one word, for
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploitation, veiled by religious and political illusions, naked,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: shameless, direct, brutal exploitation.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie has stripped of its halo every occupation
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hitherto honoured and looked up to with reverent awe.  It has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: converted the physician, the lawyer, the priest, the poet, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: man of science, into its paid wage labourers.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie has torn away from the family its sentimental
title: Communist Manifesto

text: veil, and has reduced the family relation to a mere money
title: Communist Manifesto

text: relation.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie has disclosed how it came to pass that the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: brutal display of vigour in the Middle Ages, which Reactionists
title: Communist Manifesto

text: so much admire, found its fitting complement in the most slothful
title: Communist Manifesto

text: indolence.  It has been the first to show what man's activity can
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bring about.  It has accomplished wonders far surpassing Egyptian
title: Communist Manifesto

text: pyramids, Roman aqueducts, and Gothic cathedrals; it has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conducted expeditions that put in the shade all former Exoduses
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of nations and crusades.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie cannot exist without constantly revolutionising
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the instruments of production, and thereby the relations of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: production, and with them the whole relations of society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Conservation of the old modes of production in unaltered form,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: was, on the contrary, the first condition of existence for all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: earlier industrial classes. Constant revolutionising of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: production, uninterrupted disturbance of all social conditions,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: everlasting uncertainty and agitation distinguish the bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: epoch from all earlier ones. All fixed, fast-frozen relations,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: with their train of ancient and venerable prejudices and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: opinions, are swept away, all new-formed ones become antiquated
title: Communist Manifesto

text: before they can ossify. All that is solid melts into air, all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that is holy is profaned, and man is at last compelled to face
title: Communist Manifesto

text: with sober senses, his real conditions of life, and his
title: Communist Manifesto

text: relations with his kind.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The need of a constantly expanding market for its products
title: Communist Manifesto

text: chases the bourgeoisie over the whole surface of the globe. It
title: Communist Manifesto

text: must nestle everywhere, settle everywhere, establish connexions
title: Communist Manifesto

text: everywhere.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie has through its exploitation of the world-market
title: Communist Manifesto

text: given a cosmopolitan character to production and consumption in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: every country.  To the great chagrin of Reactionists, it has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: drawn from under the feet of industry the national ground on
title: Communist Manifesto

text: which it stood.  All old-established national industries have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: been destroyed or are daily being destroyed.  They are dislodged
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by new industries, whose introduction becomes a life and death
title: Communist Manifesto

text: question for all civilised nations, by industries that no longer
title: Communist Manifesto

text: work up indigenous raw material, but raw material drawn from the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: remotest zones; industries whose products are consumed, not only
title: Communist Manifesto

text: at home, but in every quarter of the globe.  In place of the old
title: Communist Manifesto

text: wants, satisfied by the productions of the country, we find new
title: Communist Manifesto

text: wants, requiring for their satisfaction the products of distant
title: Communist Manifesto

text: lands and climes.  In place of the old local and national
title: Communist Manifesto

text: seclusion and self-sufficiency, we have intercourse in every
title: Communist Manifesto

text: direction, universal inter-dependence of nations.  And as in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: material, so also in intellectual production.  The intellectual
title: Communist Manifesto

text: creations of individual nations become common property.  National
title: Communist Manifesto

text: one-sidedness and narrow-mindedness become more and more
title: Communist Manifesto

text: impossible, and from the numerous national and local literatures,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: there arises a world literature.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie, by the rapid improvement of all instruments of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: production, by the immensely facilitated means of communication,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: draws all, even the most barbarian, nations into civilisation.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The cheap prices of its commodities are the heavy artillery with
title: Communist Manifesto

text: which it batters down all Chinese walls, with which it forces the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: barbarians' intensely obstinate hatred of foreigners to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: capitulate.  It compels all nations, on pain of extinction, to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: adopt the bourgeois mode of production; it compels them to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: introduce what it calls civilisation into their midst, i.e., to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: become bourgeois themselves.  In one word, it creates a world
title: Communist Manifesto

text: after its own image.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie has subjected the country to the rule of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: towns.  It has created enormous cities, has greatly increased the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: urban population as compared with the rural, and has thus rescued
title: Communist Manifesto

text: a considerable part of the population from the idiocy of rural
title: Communist Manifesto

text: life.  Just as it has made the country dependent on the towns, so
title: Communist Manifesto

text: it has made barbarian and semi-barbarian countries dependent on
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the civilised ones, nations of peasants on nations of bourgeois,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the East on the West.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The bourgeoisie keeps more and more doing away with the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: scattered state of the population, of the means of production,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and of property.  It has agglomerated production, and has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: concentrated property in a few hands.  The necessary consequence
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of this was political centralisation.  Independent, or but
title: Communist Manifesto

text: loosely connected provinces, with separate interests, laws,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: governments and systems of taxation, became lumped together into
title: Communist Manifesto

text: one nation, with one government, one code of laws, one national
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class-interest, one frontier and one customs-tariff.  The
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie, during its rule of scarce one hundred years, has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: created more massive and more colossal productive forces than
title: Communist Manifesto

text: have all preceding generations together.  Subjection of Nature's
title: Communist Manifesto

text: forces to man, machinery, application of chemistry to industry
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and agriculture, steam-navigation, railways, electric telegraphs,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: clearing of whole continents for cultivation, canalisation of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: rivers, whole populations conjured out of the ground--what
title: Communist Manifesto

text: earlier century had even a presentiment that such productive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: forces slumbered in the lap of social labour?
title: Communist Manifesto

text: We see then: the means of production and of exchange, on whose
title: Communist Manifesto

text: foundation the bourgeoisie built itself up, were generated in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: feudal society.  At a certain stage in the development of these
title: Communist Manifesto

text: means of production and of exchange, the conditions under which
title: Communist Manifesto

text: feudal society produced and exchanged, the feudal organisation of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: agriculture and manufacturing industry, in one word, the feudal
title: Communist Manifesto

text: relations of property became no longer compatible with the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: already developed productive forces; they became so many fetters.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They had to be burst asunder; they were burst asunder.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Into their place stepped free competition, accompanied by a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: social and political constitution adapted to it, and by the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: economical and political sway of the bourgeois class.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: A similar movement is going on before our own eyes.  Modern
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeois society with its relations of production, of exchange
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and of property, a society that has conjured up such gigantic
title: Communist Manifesto

text: means of production and of exchange, is like the sorcerer, who is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: no longer able to control the powers of the nether world whom he
title: Communist Manifesto

text: has called up by his spells.  For many a decade past the history
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of industry and commerce is but the history of the revolt of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: modern productive forces against modern conditions of production,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: against the property relations that are the conditions for the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: existence of the bourgeoisie and of its rule.  It is enough to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: mention the commercial crises that by their periodical return put
title: Communist Manifesto

text: on its trial, each time more threateningly, the existence of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: entire bourgeois society.  In these crises a great part not only
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the existing products, but also of the previously created
title: Communist Manifesto

text: productive forces, are periodically destroyed.  In these crises
title: Communist Manifesto

text: there breaks out an epidemic that, in all earlier epochs, would
title: Communist Manifesto

text: have seemed an absurdity--the epidemic of over-production.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Society suddenly finds itself put back into a state of momentary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: barbarism; it appears as if a famine, a universal war of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: devastation had cut off the supply of every means of subsistence;
title: Communist Manifesto

text: industry and commerce seem to be destroyed; and why?  Because
title: Communist Manifesto

text: there is too much civilisation, too much means of subsistence,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: too much industry, too much commerce.  The productive forces at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the disposal of society no longer tend to further the development
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the conditions of bourgeois property; on the contrary, they
title: Communist Manifesto

text: have become too powerful for these conditions, by which they are
title: Communist Manifesto

text: fettered, and so soon as they overcome these fetters, they bring
title: Communist Manifesto

text: disorder into the whole of bourgeois society, endanger the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: existence of bourgeois property.  The conditions of bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: society are too narrow to comprise the wealth created by them.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: And how does the bourgeoisie get over these crises?  On the one
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hand inforced destruction of a mass of productive forces; on the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: other, by the conquest of new markets, and by the more thorough
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploitation of the old ones.  That is to say, by paving the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: way for more extensive and more destructive crises, and by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: diminishing the means whereby crises are prevented.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The weapons with which the bourgeoisie felled feudalism to the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ground are now turned against the bourgeoisie itself.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But not only has the bourgeoisie forged the weapons that bring
title: Communist Manifesto

text: death to itself; it has also called into existence the men who
title: Communist Manifesto

text: are to wield those weapons--the modern working class--the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletarians.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In proportion as the bourgeoisie, i.e., capital, is developed,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in the same proportion is the proletariat, the modern working
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class, developed--a class of labourers, who live only so long
title: Communist Manifesto

text: as they find work, and who find work only so long as their labour
title: Communist Manifesto

text: increases capital.  These labourers, who must sell themselves
title: Communist Manifesto

text: piece-meal, are a commodity, like every other article of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: commerce, and are consequently exposed to all the vicissitudes of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: competition, to all the fluctuations of the market.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Owing to the extensive use of machinery and to division of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: labour, the work of the proletarians has lost all individual
title: Communist Manifesto

text: character, and consequently, all charm for the workman.  He
title: Communist Manifesto

text: becomes an appendage of the machine, and it is only the most
title: Communist Manifesto

text: simple, most monotonous, and most easily acquired knack, that is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: required of him.  Hence, the cost of production of a workman is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: restricted, almost entirely, to the means of subsistence that he
title: Communist Manifesto

text: requires for his maintenance, and for the propagation of his
title: Communist Manifesto

text: race.  But the price of a commodity, and therefore also of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: labour, is equal to its cost of production.  In proportion
title: Communist Manifesto

text: therefore, as the repulsiveness of the work increases, the wage
title: Communist Manifesto

text: decreases.  Nay more, in proportion as the use of machinery and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: division of labour increases, in the same proportion the burden
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of toil also increases, whether by prolongation of the working
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hours, by increase of the work exacted in a given time or by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: increased speed of the machinery, etc.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Modern industry has converted the little workshop of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: patriarchal master into the great factory of the industrial
title: Communist Manifesto

text: capitalist.  Masses of labourers, crowded into the factory, are
title: Communist Manifesto

text: organised like soldiers.  As privates of the industrial army they
title: Communist Manifesto

text: are placed under the command of a perfect hierarchy of officers
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and sergeants.  Not only are they slaves of the bourgeois class,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and of the bourgeois State; they are daily and hourly enslaved by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the machine, by the over-looker, and, above all, by the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: individual bourgeois manufacturer himself.  The more openly this
title: Communist Manifesto

text: despotism proclaims gain to be its end and aim, the more petty,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the more hateful and the more embittering it is.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The less the skill and exertion of strength implied in manual
title: Communist Manifesto

text: labour, in other words, the more modern industry becomes
title: Communist Manifesto

text: developed, the more is the labour of men superseded by that of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: women. Differences of age and sex have no longer any distinctive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: social validity for the working class. All are instruments of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: labour, more or less expensive to use, according to their age
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and sex.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: No sooner is the exploitation of the labourer by the manufacturer,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: so far at an end, that he receives his wages in cash, than he is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: set upon by the other portions of the bourgeoisie, the landlord,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the shopkeeper, the pawnbroker, etc.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The lower strata of the middle class--the small tradespeople,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: shopkeepers, retired tradesmen generally, the handicraftsmen and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: peasants--all these sink gradually into the proletariat, partly
title: Communist Manifesto

text: because their diminutive capital does not suffice for the scale
title: Communist Manifesto

text: on which Modern Industry is carried on, and is swamped in the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: competition with the large capitalists, partly because their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: specialized skill is rendered worthless by the new methods of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: production.  Thus the proletariat is recruited from all classes
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the population.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The proletariat goes through various stages of development.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: With its birth begins its struggle with the bourgeoisie.  At
title: Communist Manifesto

text: first the contest is carried on by individual labourers, then by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the workpeople of a factory, then by the operatives of one trade,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in one locality, against the individual bourgeois who directly
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploits them.  They direct their attacks not against the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeois conditions of production, but against the instruments
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of production themselves; they destroy imported wares that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: compete with their labour, they smash to pieces machinery, they
title: Communist Manifesto

text: set factories ablaze, they seek to restore by force the vanished
title: Communist Manifesto

text: status of the workman of the Middle Ages.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: At this stage the labourers still form an incoherent mass
title: Communist Manifesto

text: scattered over the whole country, and broken up by their mutual
title: Communist Manifesto

text: competition.  If anywhere they unite to form more compact bodies,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: this is not yet the consequence of their own active union, but of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the union of the bourgeoisie, which class, in order to attain its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: own political ends, is compelled to set the whole proletariat in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: motion, and is moreover yet, for a time, able to do so.  At this
title: Communist Manifesto

text: stage, therefore, the proletarians do not fight their enemies,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: but the enemies of their enemies, the remnants of absolute
title: Communist Manifesto

text: monarchy, the landowners, the non-industrial bourgeois, the petty
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie.  Thus the whole historical movement is concentrated
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in the hands of the bourgeoisie; every victory so obtained is a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: victory for the bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But with the development of industry the proletariat not only
title: Communist Manifesto

text: increases in number; it becomes concentrated in greater masses,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: its strength grows, and it feels that strength more.  The various
title: Communist Manifesto

text: interests and conditions of life within the ranks of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat are more and more equalised, in proportion as
title: Communist Manifesto

text: machinery obliterates all distinctions of labour, and nearly
title: Communist Manifesto

text: everywhere reduces wages to the same low level.  The growing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: competition among the bourgeois, and the resulting commercial
title: Communist Manifesto

text: crises, make the wages of the workers ever more fluctuating.  The
title: Communist Manifesto

text: unceasing improvement of machinery, ever more rapidly developing,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: makes their livelihood more and more precarious; the collisions
title: Communist Manifesto

text: between individual workmen and individual bourgeois take more and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: more the character of collisions between two classes.  Thereupon
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the workers begin to form combinations (Trades Unions) against
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeois; they club together in order to keep up the rate of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: wages; they found permanent associations in order to make
title: Communist Manifesto

text: provision beforehand for these occasional revolts.  Here and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: there the contest breaks out into riots.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Now and then the workers are victorious, but only for a time.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The real fruit of their battles lies, not in the immediate
title: Communist Manifesto

text: result, but in the ever-expanding union of the workers.  This
title: Communist Manifesto

text: union is helped on by the improved means of communication that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: are created by modern industry and that place the workers of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: different localities in contact with one another.  It was just
title: Communist Manifesto

text: this contact that was needed to centralise the numerous local
title: Communist Manifesto

text: struggles, all of the same character, into one national struggle
title: Communist Manifesto

text: between classes.  But every class struggle is a political
title: Communist Manifesto

text: struggle.  And that union, to attain which the burghers of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Middle Ages, with their miserable highways, required centuries,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the modern proletarians, thanks to railways, achieve in a few
title: Communist Manifesto

text: years.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: This organisation of the proletarians into a class, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: consequently into a political party, is continually being upset
title: Communist Manifesto

text: again by the competition between the workers themselves.  But it
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ever rises up again, stronger, firmer, mightier.  It compels
title: Communist Manifesto

text: legislative recognition of particular interests of the workers,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by taking advantage of the divisions among the bourgeoisie
title: Communist Manifesto

text: itself.  Thus the ten-hours' bill in England was carried.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Altogether collisions between the classes of the old society
title: Communist Manifesto

text: further, in many ways, the course of development of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat. The bourgeoisie finds itself involved in a constant
title: Communist Manifesto

text: battle. At first with the aristocracy; later on, with those
title: Communist Manifesto

text: portions of the bourgeoisie itself, whose interests have become
title: Communist Manifesto

text: antagonistic to the progress of industry; at all times, with the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie of foreign countries. In all these battles it sees
title: Communist Manifesto

text: itself compelled to appeal to the proletariat, to ask for its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: help, and thus, to drag it into the political arena. The
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie itself, therefore, supplies the proletariat with its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: own instruments of political and general education, in other
title: Communist Manifesto

text: words, it furnishes the proletariat with weapons for fighting
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Further, as we have already seen, entire sections of the ruling
title: Communist Manifesto

text: classes are, by the advance of industry, precipitated into the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat, or are at least threatened in their conditions of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: existence.  These also supply the proletariat with fresh elements
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of enlightenment and progress.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Finally, in times when the class struggle nears the decisive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hour, the process of dissolution going on within the ruling
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class, in fact within the whole range of society, assumes such a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: violent, glaring character, that a small section of the ruling
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class cuts itself adrift, and joins the revolutionary class, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class that holds the future in its hands.  Just as, therefore, at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: an earlier period, a section of the nobility went over to the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie, so now a portion of the bourgeoisie goes over to the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat, and in particular, a portion of the bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ideologists, who have raised themselves to the level of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: comprehending theoretically the historical movement as a whole.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Of all the classes that stand face to face with the bourgeoisie
title: Communist Manifesto

text: today, the proletariat alone is a really revolutionary class.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The other classes decay and finally disappear in the face of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Modern Industry; the proletariat is its special and essential
title: Communist Manifesto

text: product.  The lower middle class, the small manufacturer, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: shopkeeper, the artisan, the peasant, all these fight against the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie, to save from extinction their existence as fractions
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the middle class.  They are therefore not revolutionary, but
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conservative.  Nay more, they are reactionary, for they try
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to roll back the wheel of history.  If by chance they are
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolutionary, they are so only in view of their impending
title: Communist Manifesto

text: transfer into the proletariat, they thus defend not their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: present, but their future interests, they desert their own
title: Communist Manifesto

text: standpoint to place themselves at that of the proletariat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The "dangerous class," the social scum, that passively rotting
title: Communist Manifesto

text: mass thrown off by the lowest layers of old society, may,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: here and there, be swept into the movement by a proletarian
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolution; its conditions of life, however, prepare it far more
title: Communist Manifesto

text: for the part of a bribed tool of reactionary intrigue.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In the conditions of the proletariat, those of old society at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: large are already virtually swamped.  The proletarian is without
title: Communist Manifesto

text: property; his relation to his wife and children has no longer
title: Communist Manifesto

text: anything in common with the bourgeois family-relations; modern
title: Communist Manifesto

text: industrial labour, modern subjection to capital, the same in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: England as in France, in America as in Germany, has stripped him
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of every trace of national character.  Law, morality, religion,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: are to him so many bourgeois prejudices, behind which lurk in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ambush just as many bourgeois interests.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: All the preceding classes that got the upper hand, sought to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: fortify their already acquired status by subjecting society at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: large to their conditions of appropriation.  The proletarians
title: Communist Manifesto

text: cannot become masters of the productive forces of society, except
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by abolishing their own previous mode of appropriation, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: thereby also every other previous mode of appropriation.  They
title: Communist Manifesto

text: have nothing of their own to secure and to fortify; their mission
title: Communist Manifesto

text: is to destroy all previous securities for, and insurances of,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: individual property.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: All previous historical movements were movements of minorities,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: or in the interests of minorities.  The proletarian movement is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the self-conscious, independent movement of the immense majority,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in the interests of the immense majority.  The proletariat, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: lowest stratum of our present society, cannot stir, cannot raise
title: Communist Manifesto

text: itself up, without the whole superincumbent strata of official
title: Communist Manifesto

text: society being sprung into the air.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Though not in substance, yet in form, the struggle of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat with the bourgeoisie is at first a national struggle.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The proletariat of each country must, of course, first of all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: settle matters with its own bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In depicting the most general phases of the development of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat, we traced the more or less veiled civil war, raging
title: Communist Manifesto

text: within existing society, up to the point where that war breaks
title: Communist Manifesto

text: out into open revolution, and where the violent overthrow of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie lays the foundation for the sway of the proletariat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Hitherto, every form of society has been based, as we have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: already seen, on the antagonism of oppressing and oppressed
title: Communist Manifesto

text: classes.  But in order to oppress a class, certain conditions
title: Communist Manifesto

text: must be assured to it under which it can, at least, continue its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: slavish existence.  The serf, in the period of serfdom, raised
title: Communist Manifesto

text: himself to membership in the commune, just as the petty
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeois, under the yoke of feudal absolutism, managed to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: develop into a bourgeois.  The modern laborer, on the contrary,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: instead of rising with the progress of industry, sinks deeper and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: deeper below the conditions of existence of his own class.  He
title: Communist Manifesto

text: becomes a pauper, and pauperism develops more rapidly than
title: Communist Manifesto

text: population and wealth.  And here it becomes evident, that the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie is unfit any longer to be the ruling class in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: society, and to impose its conditions of existence upon society
title: Communist Manifesto

text: as an over-riding law.  It is unfit to rule because it is
title: Communist Manifesto

text: incompetent to assure an existence to its slave within his
title: Communist Manifesto

text: slavery, because it cannot help letting him sink into such a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: state, that it has to feed him, instead of being fed by him.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Society can no longer live under this bourgeoisie, in other
title: Communist Manifesto

text: words, its existence is no longer compatible with society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The essential condition for the existence, and for the sway of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeois class, is the formation and augmentation of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: capital; the condition for capital is wage-labour.  Wage-labour
title: Communist Manifesto

text: rests exclusively on competition between the laborers.  The
title: Communist Manifesto

text: advance of industry, whose involuntary promoter is the bourgeoisie,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: replaces the isolation of the labourers, due to competition,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by their revolutionary combination, due to association.  The
title: Communist Manifesto

text: development of Modern Industry, therefore, cuts from under its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: feet the very foundation on which the bourgeoisie produces and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: appropriates products.  What the bourgeoisie, therefore, produces,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: above all, is its own grave-diggers.  Its fall and the victory of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the proletariat are equally inevitable.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: II.  PROLETARIANS AND COMMUNISTS
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In what relation do the Communists stand to the proletarians as a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: whole?
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communists do not form a separate party opposed to other
title: Communist Manifesto

text: working-class parties.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They have no interests separate and apart from those of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat as a whole.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They do not set up any sectarian principles of their own,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by which to shape and mould the proletarian movement.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communists are distinguished from the other working-class parties
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by this only: (1) In the national struggles of the proletarians
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the different countries, they point out and bring to the front
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the common interests of the entire proletariat, independently of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: all nationality.  (2) In the various stages of development which the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: struggle of the working class against the bourgeoisie has to pass
title: Communist Manifesto

text: through, they always and everywhere represent the interests of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: movement as a whole.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communists, therefore, are on the one hand, practically,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the most advanced and resolute section of the working-class
title: Communist Manifesto

text: parties of every country, that section which pushes forward
title: Communist Manifesto

text: all others; on the other hand, theoretically, they have over
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the great mass of the proletariat the advantage of clearly
title: Communist Manifesto

text: understanding the line of march, the conditions, and the ultimate
title: Communist Manifesto

text: general results of the proletarian movement.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The immediate aim of the Communist is the same as that of all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the other proletarian parties: formation of the proletariat into
title: Communist Manifesto

text: a class, overthrow of the bourgeois supremacy, conquest of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: political power by the proletariat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The theoretical conclusions of the Communists are in no way
title: Communist Manifesto

text: based on ideas or principles that have been invented, or
title: Communist Manifesto

text: discovered, by this or that would-be universal reformer.  They
title: Communist Manifesto

text: merely express, in general terms, actual relations springing from
title: Communist Manifesto

text: an existing class struggle, from a historical movement going on
title: Communist Manifesto

text: under our very eyes.  The abolition of existing property
title: Communist Manifesto

text: relations is not at all a distinctive feature of Communism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: All property relations in the past have continually been subject
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to historical change consequent upon the change in historical
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conditions.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The French Revolution, for example, abolished feudal property in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: favour of bourgeois property.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The distinguishing feature of Communism is not the abolition of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: property generally, but the abolition of bourgeois property. But
title: Communist Manifesto

text: modern bourgeois private property is the final and most complete
title: Communist Manifesto

text: expression of the system of producing and appropriating products,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that is based on class antagonisms, on the exploitation of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: many by the few.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In this sense, the theory of the Communists may be summed up in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the single sentence: Abolition of private property.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: We Communists have been reproached with the desire of abolishing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the right of personally acquiring property as the fruit of a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: man's own labour, which property is alleged to be the groundwork
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of all personal freedom, activity and independence.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Hard-won, self-acquired, self-earned property!  Do you mean the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: property of the petty artisan and of the small peasant, a form of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: property that preceded the bourgeois form?  There is no need to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: abolish that; the development of industry has to a great extent
title: Communist Manifesto

text: already destroyed it, and is still destroying it daily.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Or do you mean modern bourgeois private property?
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But does wage-labour create any property for the labourer?  Not
title: Communist Manifesto

text: a bit.  It creates capital, i.e., that kind of property which
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploits wage-labour, and which cannot increase except upon
title: Communist Manifesto

text: condition of begetting a new supply of wage-labour for fresh
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploitation.  Property, in its present form, is based on the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: antagonism of capital and wage-labour.  Let us examine both sides
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of this antagonism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: To be a capitalist, is to have not only a purely personal, but a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: social status in production.  Capital is a collective product,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and only by the united action of many members, nay, in the last
title: Communist Manifesto

text: resort, only by the united action of all members of society,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: can it be set in motion.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Capital is, therefore, not a personal, it is a social power.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: When, therefore, capital is converted into common property, into
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the property of all members of society, personal property is not
title: Communist Manifesto

text: thereby transformed into social property. It is only the social
title: Communist Manifesto

text: character of the property that is changed. It loses its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class-character.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Let us now take wage-labour.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The average price of wage-labour is the minimum wage, i.e.,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that quantum of the means of subsistence, which is absolutely
title: Communist Manifesto

text: requisite in bare existence as a labourer.  What, therefore, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: wage-labourer appropriates by means of his labour, merely
title: Communist Manifesto

text: suffices to prolong and reproduce a bare existence.  We by no
title: Communist Manifesto

text: means intend to abolish this personal appropriation of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: products of labour, an appropriation that is made for the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: maintenance and reproduction of human life, and that leaves no
title: Communist Manifesto

text: surplus wherewith to command the labour of others.  All that we
title: Communist Manifesto

text: want to do away with, is the miserable character of this
title: Communist Manifesto

text: appropriation, under which the labourer lives merely to increase
title: Communist Manifesto

text: capital, and is allowed to live only in so far as the interest of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the ruling class requires it.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In bourgeois society, living labour is but a means to increase
title: Communist Manifesto

text: accumulated labour.  In Communist society, accumulated labour
title: Communist Manifesto

text: is but a means to widen, to enrich, to promote the existence
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the labourer.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In bourgeois society, therefore, the past dominates the present;
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in Communist society, the present dominates the past.  In
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeois society capital is independent and has individuality,

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

text: faster. United action, of the leading civilised countries at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: least, is one of the first conditions for the emancipation of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the proletariat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In proportion as the exploitation of one individual by another
title: Communist Manifesto

title: Communist Manifesto

text: to another will come to an end.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The charges against Communism made from a religious, a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: philosophical, and, generally, from an ideological standpoint,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: are not deserving of serious examination.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Does it require deep intuition to comprehend that man's ideas,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: views and conceptions, in one word, man's consciousness, changes
title: Communist Manifesto

text: with every change in the conditions of his material existence, in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: his social relations and in his social life?
title: Communist Manifesto

text: What else does the history of ideas prove, than that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: intellectual production changes its character in proportion as
title: Communist Manifesto

text: material production is changed? The ruling ideas of each age
title: Communist Manifesto

text: have ever been the ideas of its ruling class.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: When people speak of ideas that revolutionise society, they do
title: Communist Manifesto

text: but express the fact, that within the old society, the elements
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of a new one have been created, and that the dissolution of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: old ideas keeps even pace with the dissolution of the old
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conditions of existence.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: When the ancient world was in its last throes, the ancient
title: Communist Manifesto

text: religions were overcome by Christianity.  When Christian ideas
title: Communist Manifesto

text: succumbed in the 18th century to rationalist ideas, feudal
title: Communist Manifesto

text: society fought its death battle with the then revolutionary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie.  The ideas of religious liberty and freedom of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conscience merely gave expression to the sway of free competition
title: Communist Manifesto

text: within the domain of knowledge.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: "Undoubtedly," it will be said, "religious, moral, philosophical
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and juridical ideas have been modified in the course of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: historical development.  But religion, morality philosophy,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: political science, and law, constantly survived this change."
title: Communist Manifesto

text: "There are, besides, eternal truths, such as Freedom, Justice,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: etc. that are common to all states of society. But Communism
title: Communist Manifesto

text: abolishes eternal truths, it abolishes all religion, and all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: morality, instead of constituting them on a new basis; it
title: Communist Manifesto

text: therefore acts in contradiction to all past historical experience."
title: Communist Manifesto

text: What does this accusation reduce itself to?  The history of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: all past society has consisted in the development of class
title: Communist Manifesto

text: antagonisms, antagonisms that assumed different forms at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: different epochs.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But whatever form they may have taken, one fact is common to all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: past ages, viz., the exploitation of one part of society by the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: other. No wonder, then, that the social consciousness of past
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ages, despite all the multiplicity and variety it displays,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: moves within certain common forms, or general ideas, which
title: Communist Manifesto

text: cannot completely vanish except with the total disappearance of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class antagonisms.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communist revolution is the most radical rupture with
title: Communist Manifesto

text: traditional property relations; no wonder that its development
title: Communist Manifesto

text: involves the most radical rupture with traditional ideas.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But let us have done with the bourgeois objections to Communism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: We have seen above, that the first step in the revolution by the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: working class, is to raise the proletariat to the position of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ruling as to win the battle of democracy.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The proletariat will use its political supremacy to wrest, by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: degrees, all capital from the bourgeoisie, to centralise all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: instruments of production in the hands of the State, i.e., of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat organised as the ruling class; and to increase the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: total of productive forces as rapidly as possible.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Of course, in the beginning, this cannot be effected except by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: means of despotic inroads on the rights of property, and on
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the conditions of bourgeois production; by means of measures,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: therefore, which appear economically insufficient and untenable,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: but which, in the course of the movement, outstrip themselves,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: necessitate further inroads upon the old social order, and are
title: Communist Manifesto

text: unavoidable as a means of entirely revolutionising the mode of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: production.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: These measures will of course be different in different
title: Communist Manifesto

text: countries.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Nevertheless in the most advanced countries, the following will
title: Communist Manifesto

text: be pretty generally applicable.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 1.  Abolition of property in land and application of all rents
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of land to public purposes.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 2.  A heavy progressive or graduated income tax.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 3.  Abolition of all right of inheritance.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 4.  Confiscation of the property of all emigrants and rebels.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 5.  Centralisation of credit in the hands of the State, by means
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of a national bank with State capital and an exclusive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: monopoly.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 6.  Centralisation of the means of communication and transport
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in the hands of the State.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 7.  Extension of factories and instruments of production owned by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the State; the bringing into cultivation of waste-lands, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the improvement of the soil generally in accordance with a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: common plan.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 8.  Equal liability of all to labour.  Establishment of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: industrial armies, especially for agriculture.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 9.  Combination of agriculture with manufacturing industries;
title: Communist Manifesto

text: gradual abolition of the distinction between town and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: country, by a more equable distribution of the population
title: Communist Manifesto

text: over the country.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 10. Free education for all children in public schools.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Abolition of children's factory labour in its present form.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Combination of education with industrial production, &c., &c.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: When, in the course of development, class distinctions have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: disappeared, and all production has been concentrated in the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hands of a vast association of the whole nation, the public power
title: Communist Manifesto

text: will lose its political character.  Political power, properly so
title: Communist Manifesto

text: called, is merely the organised power of one class for oppressing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: another.  If the proletariat during its contest with the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie is compelled, by the force of circumstances, to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: organise itself as a class, if, by means of a revolution, it
title: Communist Manifesto

text: makes itself the ruling class, and, as such, sweeps away by force
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the old conditions of production, then it will, along with these
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conditions, have swept away the conditions for the existence of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class antagonisms and of classes generally, and will thereby have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: abolished its own supremacy as a class.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In place of the old bourgeois society, with its classes and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class antagonisms, we shall have an association, in which
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the free development of each is the condition for the free
title: Communist Manifesto

text: development of all.

text: III.  SOCIALIST AND COMMUNIST LITERATURE
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 1. REACTIONARY SOCIALISM
title: Communist Manifesto

text: A. Feudal Socialism
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Owing to their historical position, it became the vocation of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: aristocracies of France and England to write pamphlets against
title: Communist Manifesto

text: modern bourgeois society.  In the French revolution of July 1830,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and in the English reform agitation, these aristocracies again
title: Communist Manifesto

text: succumbed to the hateful upstart.  Thenceforth, a serious political
title: Communist Manifesto

text: contest was altogether out of the question.  A literary battle
title: Communist Manifesto

text: alone remained possible.  But even in the domain of literature
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the old cries of the restoration period had become impossible.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In order to arouse sympathy, the aristocracy were obliged to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: lose sight, apparently, of their own interests, and to formulate
title: Communist Manifesto

text: their indictment against the bourgeoisie in the interest of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploited working class alone.  Thus the aristocracy took their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revenge by singing lampoons on their new master, and whispering
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in his ears sinister prophecies of coming catastrophe.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In this way arose Feudal Socialism: half lamentation, half
title: Communist Manifesto

text: lampoon; half echo of the past, half menace of the future; at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: times, by its bitter, witty and incisive criticism, striking the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie to the very heart's core; but always ludicrous in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: its effect, through total incapacity to comprehend the march of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: modern history.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The aristocracy, in order to rally the people to them, waved the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletarian alms-bag in front for a banner.  But the people, so
title: Communist Manifesto

text: often as it joined them, saw on their hindquarters the old feudal
title: Communist Manifesto

text: coats of arms, and deserted with loud and irreverent laughter.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: One section of the French Legitimists and "Young England"
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exhibited this spectacle.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In pointing out that their mode of exploitation was different to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that of the bourgeoisie, the feudalists forget that they
title: Communist Manifesto

text: exploited under circumstances and conditions that were quite
title: Communist Manifesto

text: different, and that are now antiquated.  In showing that, under
title: Communist Manifesto

text: their rule, the modern proletariat never existed, they forget
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that the modern bourgeoisie is the necessary offspring of their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: own form of society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: For the rest, so little do they conceal the reactionary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: character of their criticism that their chief accusation against
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeoisie amounts to this, that under the bourgeois regime
title: Communist Manifesto

text: a class is being developed, which is destined to cut up root and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: branch the old order of society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: What they upbraid the bourgeoisie with is not so much that it
title: Communist Manifesto

text: creates a proletariat, as that it creates a revolutionary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In political practice, therefore, they join in all coercive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: measures against the working class; and in ordinary life,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: despite their high falutin phrases, they stoop to pick up the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: golden apples dropped from the tree of industry, and to barter
title: Communist Manifesto

text: truth, love, and honour for traffic in wool, beetroot-sugar, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: potato spirits.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: As the parson has ever gone hand in hand with the landlord,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: so has Clerical Socialism with Feudal Socialism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Nothing is easier than to give Christian asceticism a Socialist
title: Communist Manifesto

text: tinge. Has not Christianity declaimed against private property,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: against marriage, against the State? Has it not preached in the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: place of these, charity and poverty, celibacy and mortification
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the flesh, monastic life and Mother Church? Christian
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Socialism is but the holy water with which the priest consecrates
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the heart-burnings of the aristocrat.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: B. Petty-Bourgeois Socialism
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The feudal aristocracy was not the only class that was ruined by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeoisie, not the only class whose conditions of existence
title: Communist Manifesto

text: pined and perished in the atmosphere of modern bourgeois society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The mediaeval burgesses and the small peasant proprietors were
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the precursors of the modern bourgeoisie.  In those countries
title: Communist Manifesto

text: which are but little developed, industrially and commercially,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: these two classes still vegetate side by side with the rising
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In countries where modern civilisation has become fully
title: Communist Manifesto

text: developed, a new class of petty bourgeois has been formed,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: fluctuating between proletariat and bourgeoisie and ever renewing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: itself as a supplementary part of bourgeois society.  The
title: Communist Manifesto

text: individual members of this class, however, are being constantly
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hurled down into the proletariat by the action of competition,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and, as modern industry develops, they even see the moment
title: Communist Manifesto

text: approaching when they will completely disappear as an independent
title: Communist Manifesto

text: section of modern society, to be replaced, in manufactures,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: agriculture and commerce, by overlookers, bailiffs and shopmen.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In countries like France, where the peasants constitute far more
title: Communist Manifesto

text: than half of the population, it was natural that writers who
title: Communist Manifesto

text: sided with the proletariat against the bourgeoisie, should use,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in their criticism of the bourgeois regime, the standard of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: peasant and petty bourgeois, and from the standpoint of these
title: Communist Manifesto

text: intermediate classes should take up the cudgels for the working
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class.  Thus arose petty-bourgeois Socialism.  Sismondi was the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: head of this school, not only in France but also in England.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: This school of Socialism dissected with great acuteness the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: contradictions in the conditions of modern production.  It laid
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bare the hypocritical apologies of economists.  It proved,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: incontrovertibly, the disastrous effects of machinery and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: division of labour; the concentration of capital and land in a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: few hands; overproduction and crises; it pointed out the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: inevitable ruin of the petty bourgeois and peasant, the misery
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the proletariat, the anarchy in production, the crying
