text: inequalities in the distribution of wealth, the industrial war of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: extermination between nations, the dissolution of old moral
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bonds, of the old family relations, of the old nationalities.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In its positive aims, however, this form of Socialism aspires
title: Communist Manifesto

text: either to restoring the old means of production and of exchange,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and with them the old property relations, and the old society, or
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to cramping the modern means of production and of exchange,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: within the framework of the old property relations that have
title: Communist Manifesto

text: been, and were bound to be, exploded by those means.  In either
title: Communist Manifesto

text: case, it is both reactionary and Utopian.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Its last words are: corporate guilds for manufacture,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: patriarchal relations in agriculture.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Ultimately, when stubborn historical facts had dispersed all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: intoxicating effects of self-deception, this form of Socialism
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ended in a miserable fit of the blues.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: C. German, or "True," Socialism
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Socialist and Communist literature of France, a literature
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that originated under the pressure of a bourgeoisie in power, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that was the expression of the struggle against this power, was
title: Communist Manifesto

text: introduced into Germany at a time when the bourgeoisie, in that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: country, had just begun its contest with feudal absolutism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: German philosophers, would-be philosophers, and beaux esprits,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: eagerly seized on this literature, only forgetting, that when
title: Communist Manifesto

text: these writings immigrated from France into Germany, French social
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conditions had not immigrated along with them.  In contact with
title: Communist Manifesto

text: German social conditions, this French literature lost all its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: immediate practical significance, and assumed a purely literary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: aspect.  Thus, to the German philosophers of the eighteenth
title: Communist Manifesto

text: century, the demands of the first French Revolution were nothing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: more than the demands of "Practical Reason" in general, and the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: utterance of the will of the revolutionary French bourgeoisie
title: Communist Manifesto

text: signified in their eyes the law of pure Will, of Will as it was
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bound to be, of true human Will generally.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The world of the German literate consisted solely in bringing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the new French ideas into harmony with their ancient philosophical
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conscience, or rather, in annexing the French ideas without
title: Communist Manifesto

text: deserting their own philosophic point of view.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: This annexation took place in the same way in which a foreign
title: Communist Manifesto

text: language is appropriated, namely, by translation.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: It is well known how the monks wrote silly lives of Catholic
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Saints over the manuscripts on which the classical works of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ancient heathendom had been written.  The German literate
title: Communist Manifesto

text: reversed this process with the profane French literature.  They
title: Communist Manifesto

text: wrote their philosophical nonsense beneath the French original.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: For instance, beneath the French criticism of the economic
title: Communist Manifesto

text: functions of money, they wrote "Alienation of Humanity," and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: beneath the French criticism of the bourgeois State they wrote
title: Communist Manifesto

text: "dethronement of the Category of the General," and so forth.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The introduction of these philosophical phrases at the back of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the French historical criticisms they dubbed "Philosophy of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Action," "True Socialism," "German Science of Socialism,"
title: Communist Manifesto

text: "Philosophical Foundation of Socialism," and so on.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The French Socialist and Communist literature was thus completely
title: Communist Manifesto

text: emasculated. And, since it ceased in the hands of the German to express
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the struggle of one class with the other, he felt conscious of having
title: Communist Manifesto

text: overcome "French one-sidedness" and of representing, not true
title: Communist Manifesto

text: requirements, but the requirements of truth; not the interests of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat, but the interests of Human Nature, of Man in general, who
title: Communist Manifesto

text: belongs to no class, has no reality, who exists only in the misty realm
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of philosophical fantasy.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: This German Socialism, which took its schoolboy task so seriously
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and solemnly, and extolled its poor stock-in-trade in such
title: Communist Manifesto

text: mountebank fashion, meanwhile gradually lost its pedantic
title: Communist Manifesto

text: innocence.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The fight of the German, and especially, of the Prussian bourgeoisie,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: against feudal aristocracy and absolute monarchy, in other words, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: liberal movement, became more earnest.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: By this, the long wished-for opportunity was offered to "True"
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Socialism of confronting the political movement with the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Socialist demands, of hurling the traditional anathemas
title: Communist Manifesto

text: against liberalism, against representative government, against
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeois competition, bourgeois freedom of the press, bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: legislation, bourgeois liberty and equality, and of preaching to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the masses that they had nothing to gain, and everything to lose,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by this bourgeois movement.  German Socialism forgot, in the nick
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of time, that the French criticism, whose silly echo it was,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: presupposed the existence of modern bourgeois society, with its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: corresponding economic conditions of existence, and the political
title: Communist Manifesto

text: constitution adapted thereto, the very things whose attainment
title: Communist Manifesto

text: was the object of the pending struggle in Germany.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: To the absolute governments, with their following of parsons,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: professors, country squires and officials, it served as a welcome
title: Communist Manifesto

text: scarecrow against the threatening bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: It was a sweet finish after the bitter pills of floggings and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bullets with which these same governments, just at that time,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: dosed the German working-class risings.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: While this "True" Socialism thus served the governments as a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: weapon for fighting the German bourgeoisie, it, at the same time,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: directly represented a reactionary interest, the interest of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: German Philistines.  In Germany the petty-bourgeois class, a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: relic of the sixteenth century, and since then constantly
title: Communist Manifesto

text: cropping up again under various forms, is the real social basis
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the existing state of things.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: To preserve this class is to preserve the existing state of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: things in Germany.  The industrial and political supremacy of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie threatens it with certain destruction; on the one
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hand, from the concentration of capital; on the other, from the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: rise of a revolutionary proletariat.  "True" Socialism appeared to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: kill these two birds with one stone.  It spread like an epidemic.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The robe of speculative cobwebs, embroidered with flowers
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of rhetoric, steeped in the dew of sickly sentiment, this
title: Communist Manifesto

text: transcendental robe in which the German Socialists wrapped their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: sorry "eternal truths," all skin and bone, served to wonderfully
title: Communist Manifesto

text: increase the sale of their goods amongst such a public.  And on
title: Communist Manifesto

text: its part, German Socialism recognised, more and more, its own
title: Communist Manifesto

text: calling as the bombastic representative of the petty-bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Philistine.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: It proclaimed the German nation to be the model nation, and the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: German petty Philistine to be the typical man.  To every
title: Communist Manifesto

text: villainous meanness of this model man it gave a hidden, higher,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Socialistic interpretation, the exact contrary of its real
title: Communist Manifesto

text: character.  It went to the extreme length of directly opposing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the "brutally destructive" tendency of Communism, and of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proclaiming its supreme and impartial contempt of all class
title: Communist Manifesto

text: struggles.  With very few exceptions, all the so-called Socialist
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and Communist publications that now (1847) circulate in Germany
title: Communist Manifesto

text: belong to the domain of this foul and enervating literature.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 2. CONSERVATIVE, OR BOURGEOIS, SOCIALISM
title: Communist Manifesto

text: A part of the bourgeoisie is desirous of redressing social
title: Communist Manifesto

text: grievances, in order to secure the continued existence of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeois society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: To this section belong economists, philanthropists,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: humanitarians, improvers of the condition of the working class,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: organisers of charity, members of societies for the prevention of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: cruelty to animals, temperance fanatics, hole-and-corner
title: Communist Manifesto

text: reformers of every imaginable kind.  This form of Socialism has,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: moreover, been worked out into complete systems.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: We may cite Proudhon's Philosophie de la Misere as an example of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: this form.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Socialistic bourgeois want all the advantages of modern
title: Communist Manifesto

text: social conditions without the struggles and dangers necessarily
title: Communist Manifesto

text: resulting therefrom.  They desire the existing state of society
title: Communist Manifesto

text: minus its revolutionary and disintegrating elements.  They wish
title: Communist Manifesto

text: for a bourgeoisie without a proletariat.  The bourgeoisie
title: Communist Manifesto

text: naturally conceives the world in which it is supreme to be the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: best; and bourgeois Socialism develops this comfortable
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conception into various more or less complete systems.  In
title: Communist Manifesto

text: requiring the proletariat to carry out such a system, and thereby
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to march straightway into the social New Jerusalem, it but
title: Communist Manifesto

text: requires in reality, that the proletariat should remain within
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bounds of existing society, but should cast away all its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: hateful ideas concerning the bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: A second and more practical, but less systematic, form of this
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Socialism sought to depreciate every revolutionary movement in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the eyes of the working class, by showing that no mere political
title: Communist Manifesto

text: reform, but only a change in the material conditions of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: existence, in economic relations, could be of any advantage to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: them.  By changes in the material conditions of existence, this
title: Communist Manifesto

text: form of Socialism, however, by no means understands abolition of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeois relations of production, an abolition that can be
title: Communist Manifesto

text: effected only by a revolution, but administrative reforms, based
title: Communist Manifesto

text: on the continued existence of these relations; reforms,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: therefore, that in no respect affect the relations between
title: Communist Manifesto

text: capital and labour, but, at the best, lessen the cost, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: simplify the administrative work, of bourgeois government.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Bourgeois Socialism attains adequate expression, when, and only
title: Communist Manifesto

text: when, it becomes a mere figure of speech.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Free trade: for the benefit of the working class.  Protective
title: Communist Manifesto

text: duties: for the benefit of the working class.  Prison Reform: for
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the benefit of the working class.  This is the last word and the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: only seriously meant word of bourgeois Socialism.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: It is summed up in the phrase: the bourgeois is a bourgeois--for
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the benefit of the working class.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: 3.  CRITICAL-UTOPIAN SOCIALISM AND COMMUNISM
title: Communist Manifesto

text: We do not here refer to that literature which, in every great
title: Communist Manifesto

text: modern revolution, has always given voice to the demands of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat, such as the writings of Babeuf and others.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The first direct attempts of the proletariat to attain its own
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ends, made in times of universal excitement, when feudal society
title: Communist Manifesto

text: was being overthrown, these attempts necessarily failed, owing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to the then undeveloped state of the proletariat, as well as to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the absence of the economic conditions for its emancipation,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conditions that had yet to be produced, and could be produced
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by the impending bourgeois epoch alone. The revolutionary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: literature that accompanied these first movements of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat had necessarily a reactionary character. It
title: Communist Manifesto

text: inculcated universal asceticism and social levelling in its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: crudest form.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Socialist and Communist systems properly so called, those of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Saint-Simon, Fourier, Owen and others, spring into existence in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the early undeveloped period, described above, of the struggle
title: Communist Manifesto

text: between proletariat and bourgeoisie (see Section 1. Bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and Proletarians).
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The founders of these systems see, indeed, the class antagonisms, as
title: Communist Manifesto

text: well as the action of the decomposing elements, in the prevailing form
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of society. But the proletariat, as yet in its infancy, offers to them
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the spectacle of a class without any historical initiative or any
title: Communist Manifesto

text: independent political movement.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Since the development of class antagonism keeps even pace with
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the development of industry, the economic situation, as they find
title: Communist Manifesto

text: it, does not as yet offer to them the material conditions for the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: emancipation of the proletariat.  They therefore search after a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: new social science, after new social laws, that are to create
title: Communist Manifesto

text: these conditions.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Historical action is to yield to their personal inventive
title: Communist Manifesto

text: action, historically created conditions of emancipation to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: fantastic ones, and the gradual, spontaneous class-organisation
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the proletariat to the organisation of society specially
title: Communist Manifesto

text: contrived by these inventors.  Future history resolves itself, in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: their eyes, into the propaganda and the practical carrying out of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: their social plans.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In the formation of their plans they are conscious of caring
title: Communist Manifesto

text: chiefly for the interests of the working class, as being the most
title: Communist Manifesto

text: suffering class.  Only from the point of view of being the most
title: Communist Manifesto

text: suffering class does the proletariat exist for them.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The undeveloped state of the class struggle, as well as their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: own surroundings, causes Socialists of this kind to consider
title: Communist Manifesto

text: themselves far superior to all class antagonisms.  They want to
title: Communist Manifesto

text: improve the condition of every member of society, even that of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the most favoured.  Hence, they habitually appeal to society at
title: Communist Manifesto

text: large, without  distinction of class; nay, by preference, to the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: ruling class.  For how can people, when once they understand
title: Communist Manifesto

text: their system, fail to see in it the best possible plan of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: best possible state of society?
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Hence, they reject all political, and especially all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolutionary, action; they wish to attain their ends by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: peaceful means, and endeavour, by small experiments, necessarily
title: Communist Manifesto

text: doomed to failure, and by the force of example, to pave the way
title: Communist Manifesto

text: for the new social Gospel.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Such fantastic pictures of future society, painted at a time
title: Communist Manifesto

text: when the proletariat is still in a very undeveloped state and has
title: Communist Manifesto

text: but a fantastic conception of its own position correspond with
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the first instinctive yearnings of that class for a general
title: Communist Manifesto

text: reconstruction of society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But these Socialist and Communist publications contain also a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: critical element. They attack every principle of existing society.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Hence they are full of the most valuable materials for the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: enlightenment of the working class. The practical measures
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proposed in them--such as the abolition of the distinction
title: Communist Manifesto

text: between town and country, of the family, of the carrying on of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: industries for the account of private individuals, and of the wage
title: Communist Manifesto

text: system, the proclamation of social harmony, the conversion of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: functions of the State into a mere superintendence of production,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: all these proposals, point solely to the disappearance of class
title: Communist Manifesto

text: antagonisms which were, at that time, only just cropping up, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: which, in these publications, are recognised in their earliest,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: indistinct and undefined forms only. These proposals, therefore,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: are of a purely Utopian character.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The significance of Critical-Utopian Socialism and Communism
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bears an inverse relation to historical development.  In
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proportion as the modern class struggle develops and takes
title: Communist Manifesto

text: definite shape, this fantastic standing apart from the contest,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: these fantastic attacks on it, lose all practical value and all
title: Communist Manifesto

text: theoretical justification.  Therefore, although the originators
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of these systems were, in many respects, revolutionary, their
title: Communist Manifesto

text: disciples have, in every case, formed mere reactionary sects.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They hold fast by the original views of their masters, in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: opposition to the progressive historical development of the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat.  They, therefore, endeavour, and that consistently,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: to deaden the class struggle and to reconcile the class antagonisms.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They still dream of experimental realisation of their social
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Utopias, of founding isolated "phalansteres," of establishing
title: Communist Manifesto

text: "Home Colonies,"  of setting up a "Little Icaria"--duodecimo
title: Communist Manifesto

text: editions of the New Jerusalem--and to realise all these castles
title: Communist Manifesto

text: in the air, they are compelled to appeal to the feelings and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: purses of the bourgeois.  By degrees they sink into the category
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the reactionary conservative Socialists depicted above,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: differing from these only by more systematic pedantry, and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: by their fanatical and superstitious belief in the miraculous
title: Communist Manifesto

text: effects of their social science.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They, therefore, violently oppose all political action on the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: part of the working class; such action, according to them, can
title: Communist Manifesto

text: only result from blind unbelief in the new Gospel.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Owenites in England, and the Fourierists in France,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: respectively, oppose the Chartists and the Reformistes.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: IV.  POSITION OF THE COMMUNISTS IN RELATION TO THE
title: Communist Manifesto

text: VARIOUS EXISTING OPPOSITION PARTIES
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Section II has made clear the relations of the Communists to the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: existing working-class parties, such as the Chartists in England
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and the Agrarian Reformers in America.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communists fight for the attainment of the immediate aims,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: for the enforcement of the momentary interests of the working
title: Communist Manifesto

text: class; but in the movement of the present, they also represent
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and take care of the future of that movement.  In France the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Communists ally themselves with the Social-Democrats, against the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: conservative and radical bourgeoisie, reserving, however, the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: right to take up a critical position in regard to phrases and
title: Communist Manifesto

text: illusions traditionally handed down from the great Revolution.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In Switzerland they support the Radicals, without losing sight
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of the fact that this party consists of antagonistic elements,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: partly of Democratic Socialists, in the French sense, partly of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: radical bourgeois.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In Poland they support the party that insists on an agrarian
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolution as the prime condition for national emancipation, that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: party which fomented the insurrection of Cracow in 1846.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In Germany they fight with the bourgeoisie whenever it acts in a
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolutionary way, against the absolute monarchy, the feudal
title: Communist Manifesto

text: squirearchy, and the petty bourgeoisie.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: But they never cease, for a single instant, to instil into the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: working class the clearest possible recognition of the hostile
title: Communist Manifesto

text: antagonism between bourgeoisie and proletariat, in order that the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: German workers may straightaway use, as so many weapons against
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the bourgeoisie, the social and political conditions that the
title: Communist Manifesto

text: bourgeoisie must necessarily introduce along with its supremacy,
title: Communist Manifesto

text: and in order that, after the fall of the reactionary classes in
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Germany, the fight against the bourgeoisie itself may immediately
title: Communist Manifesto

text: begin.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communists turn their attention chiefly to Germany, because
title: Communist Manifesto

text: that country is on the eve of a bourgeois revolution that
title: Communist Manifesto

text: is bound to be carried out under more advanced conditions
title: Communist Manifesto

text: of European civilisation, and with a much more developed
title: Communist Manifesto

text: proletariat, than that of England was in the seventeenth, and of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: France in the eighteenth century, and because the bourgeois
title: Communist Manifesto

text: revolution in Germany will be but the prelude to an immediately
title: Communist Manifesto

text: following proletarian revolution.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In short, the Communists everywhere support every revolutionary
title: Communist Manifesto

text: movement against the existing social and political order of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: things.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: In all these movements they bring to the front, as the leading
title: Communist Manifesto

text: question in each, the property question, no matter what its
title: Communist Manifesto

text: degree of development at the time.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Finally, they labour everywhere for the union and agreement of
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the democratic parties of all countries.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The Communists disdain to conceal their views and aims.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They openly declare that their ends can be attained only by
title: Communist Manifesto

text: the forcible overthrow of all existing social conditions.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: Let the ruling classes tremble at a Communistic revolution.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: They have a world to win.
title: Communist Manifesto

text: WORKING MEN OF ALL COUNTRIES, UNITE!
title: Communist Manifesto
